definition: change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: It is unlikely that the recantation was sincere and he nevertheless remained under house arrest.
sentences.chinese: 伽利略的改弦易轍並不虔誠，於是在監禁中度過餘生。

sentences.english: But he doesn’t dispute that he changed direction.
sentences.chinese: 但是他最終還是改弦易轍，對這一點，他並不爭辯。
